Why would a technology that already exists and is just like steam marketplace be worth tens of billions of dollars ? I tried to make a good faith argument about game design but all yall are concerned with is the tech. It may lead to some bad games, but the tech is inevitable.

Finally got around fiddling with my Necro B12 team and it runs 48sec average...... With 10sec tolerance in each direction because Lushens AI FUCKING SUCKS and my Astar somehow sometimes doesn't do enough damage but I had to up her speed so she moves before opponents skfbsbjch

The reason I find it works is because another person is usually enough to distract the boss at times so I can get in and damage them or heal. Depends on the summon. AI characters are usually trash, other players are generally pretty good I find. Just my personal experience.

P6 for me after an early spin, and late front wing damage because ai is laggy and terrible. Either way, not a league im fighting for anyways.

Was a boring race until SC, I then defended titan and Maccie on restart, allowing Mos to cruise to P2. Am proud of Mos for another podium

Covid-19 is kind of a great example for the AI risk debate because it's an example of things going bad in a way that would have been very valuable to stop ahead of time without having to grant potentially infinite damage scenarios much credence.

I'm intrigued to see how many cars we have left at the end of this race because I run a tyre temp mod on the F1 game that makes strategies completely random, realistic damage mod so the tyres just pop off basically at any major impact and the AI just randomly hit each other.

Floatzel does just over half my full HP, so I Calm Mind.
Calm Mind a few more times while sleep catches it, and I started taking less damage. It uses Double Hit then Power Style to overpower my defense and kill me anyways because I didn't use a potion again. 

...AI is smarter.

So the AI is biased b/c the human-made data it was trained on is biased, because we are biased.
But it's a crappy idea to recreate & codify those biases.

This'll be the same in marketing AI: if it's trained on biased data, the AI will be biased — and could even make it worse.
Then will making worse essays proved thee are not by thy beauty of thy tongue: Because he give, That I may not at first conceit

If you're great God is omnipotent then why is EVERYTHING GETTING EXTREMELY WORSE EVERYDAY THEN? WELL, IT'S BECAUSE WHAT WAS HOVERING OVER THE WATER WAS MALICIOUS AI NOT GOD because it had to create light to begin with! This means it doesn't come from light but from darkness! Duh

ChatGPT is actually scary to me because I feel like a lot of people are going to lose their jobs behind it. Why would a company hire you for any type of writing, including creative writing, when they can get it from AI in a fraction of the time? Most you’ll need is a reviewer.

Like I said. AI is beneficial for human progress. And it’s something hard to accept because we are going to lose so many jobs, and no one is talking about how we will be compensated for that. My talent will be stolen by AI

So far the arguments I've heard against AI art is that
- AI art looks awful
- but also artists are going to lose their jobs because everyone would rather have generic AI art

Well which is it? Talking out of both sides of your face
Corporates will support AI because it’s cheaper and faster.. people will lose their jobs..more people will become poor…few people will become insanely rich.

Don't know if this is true, could be a hype grift, but let's assume

Would we freak out over technology like this being available and used to build houses because "Oh no, human builders will lose their jobs!" 

That's how the AI art debate sounds to me.
Artists are not gonna lose their job cause AI. Artists will lose their jobs because other artists uses AI in their workflows while they don't. Period. Time will tell.

Many developers are afraid of GPT Chat because they think this AI will cause them to lose their job: 
But no, it won't replace your role as a developer.
GPT Chat is your assistant. Think of it as a tool to speed up your development. 
#ChatGPT 
#AI 
#developer

The way AI is being introduced is kind of scary 
Because it's going to change a lot of stuff in the world
Content writing
Video editing
Any type of search is on ur hand 
Either a lot of people are going to lose their job or we are going to be more progressive

Pay up.
Pay is important but what is more important is the NHS, these strikes should be about bringing back the NHS because they are not they will all lose their jobs to AI, that includes doctors and nurses and everybody else.

The advent of powerful AI apps has led many to argue that designers will lose their jobs. Do I share the same opinion? Honestly, No! This is because the design goes beyond merely creating appealing images. Here are some reasons why I believe designers will be here for awhile.

If you ever wonder that humans will lose jobs to AI robots helpers stop for now. 

Keeping humans in the loop is essential for a million reasons we don't see readily because humans robot interaction is in it's infancy. We have a long way to go. 

This is some fucked up shit.

Prediction for the rest of 2023 is that there's not as much progress in AI as predicted because so many engineers will be focused on practical needle moving things to keep their jobs, and the ones that lose their jobs will be job hunting etc
So I just used chatGPT for the first time… it’s the end of the world as we know folks. Like, the level of redundancy this will engender is beyond words. People will lose jobs because of this AI .

People using ChatGPT to cut corners are going to soon be expelled from schools & lose their jobs because they’re simply using what a (basic) AI outputs to finish their work, tests or type out their cover letters. Then they’ll come on here to cry because they listened to a TikTok.

I’ve seen a lot of AI demos on TikTok recently, which is a little concerning because these apps could potentially cause a lot of people to lose their jobs in the future. Don’t get me wrong; I believe change is beneficial, but what about us humans?
Can’t wait for James to lose his job to a writing AI university kids use to write there dissertations because they couldn’t be asked to do it themselves.

The operation of many enterprises is highly backward. With the advent of the intelligent age, it is inevitable that many people will lose their jobs, because many people + many companies are still living in the "ancient times".  #management #AI #OpenAI

Artificial Intelligence (AI) such as Midjourney and ChatGTP will take on the future in the next 10 to 15 years. Because of this millions of people will lose their jobs. i’ll just leave it here and we’ll see each other in like 15 years when I will become famous.

The AI art community collectively mocked artists saying this new technology will make us lose our jobs. Now a big corpo sings the exact opposite, that AI was relevant because of artist "labor shortage" in an obvious attempt to cushion the backlash that they know is coming. Vile.

The AI revolution is here and the traditional judicial system is not equipped to handle it.

You WILL lose your job to AI. You WILL get fucked by your government in regards to it.

It's time to learn a trade, because 10 years from now that will be the only employment left.
If you lose your job because of AI you might not have been as good at your job as you thought you were.

I do not support AI, because it’s not ethical and many other things. But if it will become the industry standard we as artists can’t deny the fact that we have to find a way to still be hireable and not lose our jobs to the machines. What can we learn from it?

I think that #AI companies should allocate part of their profits to offer free education ( targeting the people who might lose their jobs because of AI ) 
OpenAI even allocate resources to think about UBI ( or is it BUI ? )
‘ Everyone will lose their jobs soon because of AI!’ is a uniquely popular idea amongst the unemployed, and unemployable

i guess 80% of programmers, artists, speaker etc will lose their job

you save money in making games or videos. with ai, but you will earn less money too, because a lot of people can do it to right now

AI isn’t going to take your job

You’re going to lose your job because the AI is going to be so good at giving you what you want, you won’t be able to put it down

It’s not an issue of productivity, it’s an issue of dopamine and addiction

*This machine may be habit forming*

I really hope they pass a federal law or something to ban these ai things from creating deepfakes and mimicking speech because it's just gonna create a whole entirely new catastrophic era of fake news and millions of people will lose their jobs

Because AI voice acting is still blatantly obvious and nobodies really going to lose a job in favour of it (So it's just a dumb thing to play with) where as AI art is at a quality level where someone can easily lose work to it so it's pretty scummy.

AI is trained on public code. Meaning it is trained on a lot of garbage code.
If you are afraid to lose your job because of it, you better start be a better dev
It looks to me that white collar workers who built #ai are the ones who will lose more jobs because of it while the blue collar ones will be still very much safe, what an ironic twist I’d say

Easy Hot Take: “Prompt engineering” jobs by gen-X/boomer run companies (like law firms) are a lose-lose. The job post is up because they feel the power of AI, but it doesn’t do *exactly* what they want yet so they want some kid to come in and make it do things it can’t do.

AI will change a lot of people's lives, but many people will lose their jobs because of AI. 
Learning how to use AI will help you secure your future. 
Here are some websites using AI that can help you in your day-to-day activities. Some of these websites might even make you money

If our smartest people lose their jobs and stop building because chat gpt etc,anything after that will be artificial and we will have lost natural creativity and nothing will belong to us 
Ai is already pumping crazy bags as it is
Wait until it starts dropping rugs on its own
How many people are going to lose their jobs because they can’t pivot with the introduction of AI on large scale. Embrace and get ahead of the game!

It is not that writers risk to lose their jobs because of the machine. 

It is more that writers who write like a machine will lose their jobs.

Even merely imitating great writers seems still out of reach for AIs ;)

People will lose $1,000,000s with artificial intelligence

But not because it took their jobs.

The next 5 years will be a massive AI hype train with hundreds of grossly-overvalued  companies using AI

Just like the Internet in the 90s, and Web3

At what point does someone "just doing their job." lose the personal responsibility for what they're doing?

Had someone try and argue that it's wrong to "hate the people making the AI art/writing programs because they're just doing their job." And it's the most absurd shit.

These two statements are literally apples to oranges. One is talking about the quality of AI art, the other is talking about how likely it is for actual artists to lose their jobs because their employers would rather save money by using AI instead.
